title: RAG-First Documentation: From Diagrams to Living Text Structures
hook: Classic SAP documentation dies the moment reality changes. Diagrams freeze assumptions. Text structures evolve.
idea: Modern AMS documentation is not visual-first and not static. It is structured, typed text designed for retrieval, recombination, and reasoning by humans and AI. Diagrams become optional views — never the source of truth.

problems: They don’t encode decisions or trade-offs
They are interpreted differently by each reader

principles: Text is searchable, composable, and versionable
Text can encode conditions, constraints, and logic
Text works in chat, incidents, audits, and automation
text_as_the_primary_model.rule: If it cannot be expressed as structured text, it is not operational knowledge.

meta_model_concept.definition: A meta-model defines how knowledge is expressed, linked, and reasoned about — independent of tools.

fact_atom.example: Pricing condition PR00 is mandatory for OTC flow in EU companies.

combination_atom.example: BP type = ZCUST + country = DE + sales_org = 1000 → requires partner functions SH, BP, PY.

why_combinations_matter.truth: Most SAP incidents happen not because a value is wrong, but because a combination is unhandled.

retrieval_patterns: Given value set → retrieve known failure interactions

diagrams_repositioned.rule: Diagrams are views. Text is truth.

copilot_moves: Extract atoms from incidents and changes.
Suggest new rule or combination atoms when patterns repeat.
Validate text atoms against real system signals.

why_this_is_a_power_move: Knowledge scales across systems and vendors.
design_question: If an incident happens in a rare combination of values, can our documentation explain the behavior — or only show a picture?
